page.title: 13Local History
page.content: Furnace Green (C1) is a neighbourhood of Crawley. It gained it's name from the fact that a charcoal iron furnace was worked in that area -Tilgate Furnace. The furnace itself was sited in the area of Laurel Close. Many of the original owners of the houses recently built there have found pieces of slag, silica and impure iron remains of the iron ore and lemestone smelted there. Neatby in Long Wood there are still the remains of the charcoal burners - a lot of charcoal is lying about. Alongside the wood traces of the river, which was diverted to provide power for the iron workings, are still to be found. Many of the street names in Furnace Green have connections withe the iron workings - Furnace Drive, Furnace Parade and Furnace Farm Road among them. The pub is the Charcoal Burner.
